2009/7/1 Kenneth Stanley <kstanley@...>:
>
> Colin, I don't think there is any agreed standard set. However, I generally
> recommend not having more than one of each kind.

Understood. Start with a minimal set and maybe introduce others at a
later time if they show promise. E.g. I wonder about functions with
abrupt changes in rate of change, e.g. abs and square, and whether
they are complementary or substitutes for functions with a similar
overall profile but with smoother curves, e.g. gaussian and sine.

> I also agree that something like an unbounded linear function can have
> unintended consequences.
>
> My guess is that even sigmoids and Gaussians alone can work well, although
> it's just a hunch.
>

Thanks.
